com.jswiff.swfrecords
Class SoundInfo

java.lang.Object
  com.jswiff.swfrecords.SoundInfo
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class SoundInfo
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class provides information used for playing an event sound defined with the DefineSound tag.

See Also:
DefineSound, Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
SoundInfo()
          Creates a new SoundInfo instance.
SoundInfo(InputBitStream stream)
          Creates a new SoundInfo instance, reading data from a bit stream.
 
Method Summary
 SoundEnvelope[] getEnvelopeRecords()
          Returns the envelope records (used for time-based volume control).
 long getInPoint()
          Returns the in-point of the sound, i.e. the number of samples to be skipped at the beginning.
 int getLoopCount()
          Returns the loop count, i.e. how many times the sound repeats.
 long getOutPoint()
          Returns the out-point, i.e. the position in samples of the last sample to be played.
 boolean hasEnvelope()
          Checks if envelope information is present.
 boolean hasInPoint()
          Checks if in-point information (number of samples to skip at beginning) is supplied.
 boolean hasLoops()
          Checks if loop information is contained.
 boolean hasOutPoint()
          Checks if out-point information is present.
 boolean isSyncNoMultiple()
          Checks the syncNoMultiple flag.
 boolean isSyncStop()
          Checks the syncStop flag.
 void setEnvelopeRecords(SoundEnvelope[] envelopeRecords)
          Sets the envelope records (used for time-based volume control).
 void setInPoint(long inPoint)
          Sets the in-point of the sound, i.e. the number of samples to be skipped at the beginning.
 void setLoopCount(int loopCount)
          Sets the loop count, i.e. how many times the sound repeats.
 void setOutPoint(long outPoint)
          Sets the sound's out-point, i.e. the position in samples of the last sample to be played.
 void setSyncNoMultiple()
          Sets the syncNoMultiple flag.
 void setSyncStop()
          Sets the syncStop flag.
 void write(OutputBitStream stream)
          Writes the sound information to a bit stream.

Returns the envelope records (used for time-based volume control).

envelope records

getInPoint

public long getInPoint()
Returns the in-point of the sound, i.e. the number of samples to be skipped at the beginning.

Returns:
in-point

getLoopCount

public int getLoopCount()
Returns the loop count, i.e. how many times the sound repeats.

Returns:
loop count

getOutPoint

public long getOutPoint()
Returns the out-point, i.e. the position in samples of the last sample to be played. Check with hasOutPoint() first if the information is supplied.

Returns:
out-point of sound

hasEnvelope

public boolean hasEnvelope()
Checks if envelope information is present.

Returns:
true if envelope information provided

hasInPoint

public boolean hasInPoint()
Checks if in-point information (number of samples to skip at beginning) is supplied.

Returns:
true if in-point information provided

hasLoops

public boolean hasLoops()
Checks if loop information is contained.

Returns:
true if loop information provided

hasOutPoint

public boolean hasOutPoint()
Checks if out-point information is present.

Returns:
true if out-point information provided

isSyncNoMultiple

public boolean isSyncNoMultiple()
Checks the syncNoMultiple flag. If set, a sound isn't started if already playing.

Returns:
true if flag set, else false

isSyncStop

public boolean isSyncStop()
Checks the syncStop flag. If set, the sound is stoppped.

Returns:
true if flag set, else false

setEnvelopeRecords

Sets the envelope records (used for time-based volume control).

Parameters:
envelopeRecords - envelope records

inPoint - in point

Sets the loop count, i.e. how many times the sound repeats.

Parameters:
loopCount - loop count

setOutPoint

public void setOutPoint(long outPoint)
Sets the sound's out-point, i.e. the position in samples of the last sample to be played.

Parameters:
outPoint - of sound

setSyncNoMultiple

public void setSyncNoMultiple()
Sets the syncNoMultiple flag. If set, a sound isn't started if already playing.

setSyncStop

public void setSyncStop()
Sets the syncStop flag. If set, the sound is stoppped.
